title: Using Deep Learning to Identify Artificial Satellite Trails in Multi-band Photometric Astronomical Images
summary: This research addresses the growing challenge of artificial satellite trail interference in ground-based astronomical observations by developing an efficient deep learning identification method. It uses multi-band photometric survey observational data to accurately detect satellite trails and preserve astronomical data quality.
usefulness_reason: The paper explicitly mentions "photometric survey observational data" which aligns with "Survey data". The identification of "satellite trails" can be interpreted as detecting spatio-temporal events, which has connections to "Spatio Temporal" and "Point Process" concepts, even if not explicitly using those terms.
